name: BEST WESTERN Restormel Lodge

reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel. It isn't posh,and could do with a lick of paint in some places, but the rooms are clean and quiet. The breakfast is very good, and the service is outstanding.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: We will definetely stay there again if we return.
reviews.title: The staff make this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Restormel for 3 nights and 4 days. On first arrival we were a bit uncertain but we were proved wrong! We booked using Tesco vouchers so the price was heavily reduced.
reviews.title: Decent value

reviews.text: From the start the hotel staff were extremely helpful. We had been given a family room with a double and a small single connect room with a travel cot. All nicely decorated, in good condition with lots of storage and very clean. Perfect!
reviews.title: Great Place, shame about the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a wide selection of food for breakfast and they reserved us a table every morning with a high chair and were very attentive to our needs.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money, recommend it to a friend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for two nights from 14th to 16th October. We got a deal through lastminute.com for £59 for the two of us with breakfast which we thought was too good to be true. Having read the reviews we went with an open mind, not expecting too much.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, splendid location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in a lovely, peaceful setting. Check in was easy and our room was fine (despite the fact that there were only two of us we were given a room with two bedrooms!). The room was clean and the bed comfortable. We would however agree that the shower being attached to the wall with no shower curtain was a bit of a nonsense!!
reviews.title: More minus than plus - and don't forget your earplugs

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent and the staff were extremely attentive. All in all it was a really good experience made even better because of the price. Do try the Globe Inn for food - it is a great, friendly pub and the staff there are very attentive too.
reviews.title: Extemely nice, no unpleasant surprices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really wanted to like this hotel but. unfortunately there were too many negative aspects.
reviews.title: very disappointing and not one that I would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay
Good clean hotel, great location for Eden
Good Value & Clean
reviews.text: Only fault window frame and handle was very dirty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the previous reviews we thought this was a good hotel to stay at and were not disappointed. Our room was very clean and pleasant, the staff were helpful and food was good.
reviews.title: Holiday in Cornwall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for an overnight stay. Arrived early hours of morning, our room key with clear directions to our room were left on reception desk. Our room was very spacious, spotlessly clean and very tastefully furnished. Bathroom again spotless, with lots of freshly laundered towels. Dining room and staff very welcoming, ordered full English breakfast, copious amounts of tea+coffee, which were delicious! we paid £29.00 for a double room inclusive of breakfast. Fab hotel, with very friendly, cou teous staff. Would highly recommend a stay here. Excellent value for money. Well done Best Western!
reviews.title: Gem of a hotel, extremely surprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in the town of Lostwithiel, ex.capital of Cornwall and very interesting in it's own right. The town is best explored on foot with its winding streets and river walks. While we had little opportunity to visit the shops, the whole town appeared vibrant with varied shops rather than those that can be found in any town centre.
reviews.title: Great for touring Cornwall

reviews.text: The hotel has evolved from an old building and has a good restaurant, bar, small swimming pool (summer) and outdoor seating area. I can be reached on foot from the railway station where mainline (London to Penzance) and local services stop. Major visitor attractions can be accessed by train from this station and so you don't need your car although the hotel does have a car park too.
reviews.title: Best of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom was very clean and comfortable with everything we needed. Breakfast and dinner were good and the service in the whole hotel was of a high and friendly standard.
reviews.title: Friendly,clean,tidy,excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: mediocre - and the sheets didnt fit the bed!

description: Situated in the heart of the Fowey Valley, Lostwithiel has been recently classified as the most desirable place to live in the United Kingdom, Best Western Restormel Lodge Hotel offers modern comfort and traditional hospitality. Best Western Restormel Lodge Hotel is centrally situated on the A390 with many places of interest within Cornwall in easy reach. Eden Project is 6 miles away, Lost Gardens of Heligan is 12 miles and National Trust Lanhydrock House is only 3 miles. In addition to this, the hotel boasts a prime location in the peaceful town of Lostwithiel famous for antiques and the Duchy Palace (the oldest building in Cornwall), something much appreciated by the many guests who return year after year. The hotel has been modernised and is up to date with free WiFi throughout and all rooms have 22" flat screen televisions with freeview.The outdoor heated swimming pool is open from April to October and provides a refreshing start to the day.Pets are welcome within certain rooms only.
